description: Installation of prefabricated single storey Parks pavilion building in Elthorne Park to be used for a café/community and sports events Mixed Use Class E (b), Learning Institutions (F1) and Local Community (F2(a)-F2(c); refurbishment of the existing associated fenced off tennis courts sports areas and installation of new sports lighting
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).
| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s):

Drawing number LBEP/EPP/01 - Location plan, Drawing number LBEP/EPP/02 - Location plan, Drawing number LBEP/EPP/03 - Block plan, Drawing number LBEP/EPP/04 - Block plan, Drawing number LBEP/EPP/05 - Proposed floor plan, Drawing number LBEP/EPP/06 - Elevations for café, Drawing number LBEP/EPP/07 - Elevations for café, Drawing number LBEP/EPP/08 - Existing and proposed tennis court plans, Drawing number LBEP/EPP/09 - Proposed south west elevation, Drawing number LBEP/EPP/10 - Proposed elevations for fencing and flood lights, Drawing number LBEP/EPP/11 - Proposed north west views, Drawing number LBEP/EPP/12 - Proposed flood lights,
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.

| Prior to construction of the café, the materials to be used for the external surfaces of the café shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. This condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application. Development shall be carried out only in accordance with the approved details and permanently retained thereafter.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4, 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D1 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).
| No part of the roof of the café shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.

Reason: To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 2.1 of the Ealing Development Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D1 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).

| Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 as amended by the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015, the proposed café shall only be used under Class E (b) and F1 (a) and (b) and F2 (a) (b) and (c) and not for any other use without permission of the Local Planning Authority obtained by the submission of a planning application.

Reason: To protect the character and amenity of the area and to safeguard the employment land in accordance with 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), Policies D3, D14, E8 of the London Plan, policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), Ealing SPG10 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021)

| The hours of operation for the floodlights, hereby approved shall be between 08:00 to 21:00 Monday through Sunday and all public holidays. The floodlights must be switched off outside of these hours.

REASON: To ensure that nearby residents are adequately protected against noise and light pollution generated from the development in accordance with policies D6 and D14 of the London Plan (2021); 1.1 of the Local Development Framework (Core) Strategy (2012); 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013); and the Interim Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 'Noise and Vibration'.

| The hours of operation for the café/ community use, hereby approved shall be between 07:00 to 21:00 Monday through Sunday and all public holidays. The Café/ community use must be not open/ used outside of these hours.

REASON: To ensure that nearby residents are adequately protected against noise and light pollution generated from the development in accordance with policies D6 and D14 of the London Plan (2021); 1.1 of the Local Development Framework (Core) Strategy (2012);; 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013); and the Interim Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 'Noise and Vibration'. | No speakers or other sources that could create noise (such as a tannoy) shall be erected on the exterior of the café/ community use building or attached to the new flood lights.

Reason: To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 2.1 of the Ealing Development Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D1 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).
| Prior to use, the shutters on the café/ community use building shall be installed with smooth roller guides and buffered closing mechanism and be maintained as such.

Reason: To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 2.1 of the Ealing Development Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D1 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).

| The floodlight for the tennis courts shall not exceed the vertical illumination lux levels at neighbouring premises that are recommended for Environmental Zone 3 by the Institution of Lighting Professionals in the 'Guidance Note 01/20 For The Reduction Of Obtrusive Light'.  Glare and sky glow should be prevented by correctly using, locating, aiming and shielding luminaires, in accordance with the Guidance Note.

Reason: To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 2.1 of the Ealing Development Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D1 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).
| Deliveries and collection of goods and waste from the facilities shall not take place outside the hours of 0800 to 2000 hours Mondays to Saturdays.

Reason: To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 2.1 of the Ealing Development Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D1 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).
